column4: ok, how can my boyfriend see my shared files via network on his computer?
i have the folder shared
well really, i need to see his shared folders on windows how i see them?
does he need to have a program to see shared folders in Linux or should it just work?
probably judg3
what are you sharing the folder with? Samba?
i believe so chousuke system>administration>shared folders
get the NTFS configuration tool
and he's using linux too? hmm.
chousuke: no he isn't he's using Windows...i need to move alot of my crap from my windows partition, reformat totally to Linux, then move it all back
I see.
from windows you should be able to "connect to a network drive" or something I guess.
I'm not really sure how it works.
!samba | Ongaku
i have samba i think
does it come installed in gusty, im upgrading to gusty
yeah, it does.
it's in all versions of ubuntu, though.
chousuke: ah cool, he has a firewall and stuff but I can work around that...just need to disable it and connect to the network
chousuke: my HDD is so small i can't just keep it on a lil partition so i have to move it over to his computer
I see.
I have to sleep now though, so someone else will have to help you with that.
